Lore: One of the Rebellion's main contacts on Tatooine. Widely regarded as a \b leader\b0  in the Mos Eisley alien community. Aging male Defel. Has lost the ability to warp light.
Gametext: When deployed, you may take one non-unique alien into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Your aliens deploy -1 to same or adjacent Tatooine site.
Pulls: Alderaan Operative\par Anoat Operative\par Arcona\par Baragwin\par Baragwin (V)\par B'omarr Monk\par Bothan Spy\par Bothawui Operative\par Chadra-Fan\par Clak'dor VII Operative\par Cloud City Technician\par Cloud City Trooper\par Corellian\par Devaronian\par Droid Merchant\par Elom\par Ewok Sentry\par Ewok Spearman\par Ewok Tribesman\par Florn Lamproid\par Gran\par Gungan General\par Gungan Guard\par Gungan Warrior\par H'nemthe\par Ishi Tib\par Ithorian\par Jawa\par Jawa (EP1)\par Jedi Survivor (V)\par Kashyyyk Operative\par Kiffex Operative\par Kirdo III Operative\par Kitonak\par Klatooinian Revolutionary\par Moisture Farmer\par Ortolan\par Palace Raider\par Palace Raider (V)\par Ralltir Freighter Captain\par Ralltir Operative\par Saurin\par Shistavanen Wolfman\par Sic-Six\par Snivvian\par Talz\par Tibanna Gas Miner\par Tibrin Operative\par Wookiee\par Wookiee (V)\par Yarkora

Lore: Part of Vader's hand-picked squadron stationed at the Death Star. Boasts the latest in Imperial weaponry. Each pilot and starfighter is at the peak of readiness.
Gametext: Deploy -2 to Death Star or same location as Vader. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 2 and adds 2 to power. Adds 1 to its weapon destiny draws.
Information: TIE/lns are forfeit +2 at same location as Vengeance.
IsPulled: All Power To Weapons\par Black 1 (V)\par Commander Brandei\par Deflector Shield Generators (V)\par Short Range Fighters

Lore: Male Morseerian \b leader\b0. Methane breather. Has ties to Tatooine's Imperial government. Uses alien agents to maintain surveillance on Jabba and the Rebellion.
Gametext: When deployed, you may take one non-unique alien into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Your aliens deploy -1 to same or adjacent Tatooine site.
If you control, Force drain -1 here.   If you control, all non-unique Imperials are power and forfeit +1 and Imperial trooper guards may move.
LightSideText: If you control, Force drain -1 here.
DarkSideText: If you control, all non-unique Imperials are power and forfeit +1 and Imperial trooper guards may move.
IsPulled: A Sith's Plans (V)\par Commander Merrejk\par Establish Control (V)\par General Nevar (V)\par Kuat Drive Yards (V)\par Voyeur (V)\par Watch Your Back! (V)

Gametext: If you control, all non-unique Rebels are power and forfeit +1 and Rebel guards may move.   If you control, Force drain -1 here.
LightSideText: If you control, all non-unique Rebels are power and forfeit +1 and Rebel guards may move.

IsPulled: A New Secret Base\par A Jedi's Plans (V)\par Darklighter Spin (V)\par Mindful Of The Future\par Restore Freedom To The Galaxy (V)\par Romas "Lock" Navander (V)\par Senator Mon Mothma (V)\par Visored Vision (V)

Lore: Introduced during the Clone Wars. 600 meters long. Some have cargo space converted to TIE hangar bays. Still used to maintain an Imperial presence in the Outer Rim.
Gametext: May add 3 pilots, 6 passengers and 4 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilots provide total ability of 2. Turbolaser Battery may deploy aboard. Your TIEs present are each power +1.
Information: If Wooof (V8) revealed with Combat Response, he may deploy with any cruiser:\par \par Dreadnaught-Class Heavy Cruiser\par Jabba's Space Cruiser\par Jabba's Space Cruiser (V8)
IsPulled: Early Warning Network\par Grand Admiral Thrawn (V)\par Prepared Defenses (V)
Combo: Dreadnaught-Class Heavy Cruiser + Kessel + 4 TIE Fighters\par -----\par Dreadnaught-Class Heavy Cruiser + Darth Vader + Vader's Custom TIE + DS-61-2 + Black 2 + DS-61-3 + Black 3 + DS-61-4 + Black 4

Lore: Unlike the Empire, the Alliance treats their droids with respect. Many droids volunteered to share the risk of battle and aid the Rebellion's assault on the Death Star.
Gametext: Deploy on an opponent's location. Whenever you lose a droid from hand or Life Force, it satisfies Force loss up to its forfeit value. Once per turn, you may play Scomp Link Access to cancel a Force drain where you have a droid. Effect canceled if opponent controls this location.
Information: This card satisfies Force Loss like battle damage, Force drains and direct damage, but not attrition (being no Force Loss).\par Note that when you lose a droid from Reserve Deck (or Used Pile or Force Pile) it will satisfy Force Loss up to its forfeit value, too.
IsPulled: It's Not My Fault (V)\par The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Wokling (V)

Lore: The Empire often uses droids for nefarious purposes. Imperials compel droids to do jobs that are repugnant to humans. An automaton has no ethical conscience.
Gametext: Deploy on an opponent's location. Whenever you lose a droid from hand or Life Force, it satisfies Force loss up to its forfeit value. Once per turn, you may play Imperial Code Cylinder to cancel a Force drain where you have a droid. Effect canceled if opponent controls this location.
Information: This card satisfies Force Loss like battle damage, Force drains and direct damage, but not attrition (being no Force Loss).\par Note that when you lose a droid from Reserve Deck (or Used Pile or Force Pile) it will satisfy Force Loss up to its forfeit value, too.
IsPulled: 3,720 To 1 (V12) (from Lost Pile).\par Breached Defenses & Molator (V)\par Crossfire (V)\par Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: Gold Squadron had the best Y-wing pilots in the Alliance. Lead by Jon 'Dutch' Vander. First wave of starfighters to assault the Death Star. Many were lost in the Battle of Yavin.
Gametext: Deploy -2 at Yavin 4 or to same location as Dutch. May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 2 and adds 2 to power. Adds 1 to its ion cannon weapon destiny draws.
IsPulled: All Wings Report In\par Organized Attack

Lore: Red Leader fired the first shot in the Death Star trench, causing massive internal damage. The spectacular near-miss inspired Red Squadron to double their efforts.
Gametext: USED: Cancel a Force drain at a site related to a system you control. LOST: Cancel Counter Assault, It's Worse, Elis Helrot, Tallon Roll, Limited Resources or Scanning Crew. OR Use 3 Force to search your Lost Pile and take one non-unique starfighter into hand.
Pulls: One non-unique starfighter from Lost Pile.
Cancels: A Force drain at a site related to a system you control.\par Counter Assault\par Dark Maneuvers & Tallon Roll\par Elis Helrot\par It's Worse\par It's Worse (V16)\par Limited Resources\par Ommni Box & It's Worse\par Scanning Crew\par Tallon Roll

Lore: Modified TIE fighter. Specifically adapted for atmospheric engagement. Some are fitted with high-output solar panels to support improved weaponry.
Gametext: Deploy -1 at any cloud sector. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2 and adds 2 to power. Power +2 at non-unique cloud sectors. Boosted TIE Cannon may deploy aboard and fires free aboard.
Information: TIE/lns are forfeit +2 at same location as Vengeance.
IsPulled: All Power To Weapons\par Commander Brandei\par Deflector Shield Generators (V)\par I'm Sorry (V)\par Short Range Fighters

Lore: New Rebel troopers gain invaluable experience while acting as support for seasoned troops. The Alliance prefers to assign rookies to soldiers on a one-to-one basis.
Gametext: Deploys free to same site as a Rebel leader. Adds 1 to power of one non-unique Rebel warrior present. When forfeited at same site as a Rebel 'veteran' (a leader or non-recruit trooper), also satisfies all remaining attrition against you.
IsPulled: Mon Mothma\par Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

Lore: Most Red Squadron pilots trained under Garven Dreis. Flew top cover during the Battle of Yavin. Became famous for Red 5's historic attack run.
Gametext: Deploy -2 at Yavin 4 or to same location as Red Leader. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2 and adds 2 to power. Proton Torpedoes deploy and fire free aboard.
IsPulled: All Wings Report In\par Organized Attack
Combo: Red Squadron X-wing + X-wing + Organized Attack

Lore: After months of intense training, a trooper is paired with a veteran soldier. While providing support during field operations, the new trooper masters Imperial military tactics.
Gametext: Deploys free to same site as an Imperial leader. Adds 1 to power of one non-unique Imperial warrior present. When forfeited at same site as an Imperial 'veteran' (a leader or non-cadet trooper), also satisfies all remaining attrition against you.

USED: Cancel a Force drain at a site related to a system you control. LOST: Cancel Surprise Assault, It Could Be Worse, Nabrun Leids, Collision! or Hyper Escape. OR Lose 1 Force to search your Lost Pile and take one non-unique starfighter into hand.
Pulls: One non-unique starfighter from Lost Pile
Cancels: A Force drain at a site related to a system you control.\par Collision!\par Hyper Escape\par It Could Be Worse\par Nabrun Leids\par Surprise Assault

Gametext: If you control, Force drain +1 here (+2 if a Vaporator present).   If you control, with a Tusken Raider present, Force drain +1 here.
LightSideText: If you control, Force drain +1 here (+2 if a Vaporator present).
DarkSideText: If you control, with a Tusken Raider present, Force drain +1 here.
Information: Since the Dawn Of Time (or at least the Premiere release), Tatooine: Jundland Wastes has been the best starting location for the Dark Side in sealed deck competition. Now each Light Side player gets a chance to bounce that evil site back to the Dark Side player's Reserve Deck.\par \par The Light Side Jundland Wastes also gives a Force drain bonus when a Vaporator is played there. This provides a boost when combining with other cards often found in Premiere packs for sealed-deck competition.\par \par In constructed-deck play, this site becomes an effective weapon to fight a ground-based, Tatooine Force drain strategy. The ability to convert the site and capitalize on its own Force drain bonus lets the Light Side grab the initiative.
IsPulled: A Jedi's Plans (V)\par Master Kenobi (V)\par Mindful Of The Future\par Senator Mon Mothma (V)\par Visored Vision (V)\par Yarna d'al' Gargan (V)
Combo: Tatooine: Jundland Wastes + Vaporator + Owen Lars + Beru Lars + Hydroponic Station\par Let's total it up... for 5 Force and 5 cards, that's ability 4, power 4, forfeit 9 and a Force drain of 3 (and draw the first 2 Force activated directly into your hand). Not bad for a couple of middle-aged Rebels.\par -----\par Tatooine: Jundland Wastes + Vaporator + Luke Skywalker + Anakin's Lightsaber + Obi-Wan + Obi-Wan's Lightsaber + Lightsaber Proficiency + Chewbacca + Jedi Lightsaber\par A total ability of 12, power 14, forfeit 22 and a Force drain of 6! Talk about an Undercover spy magnet...

Gametext: If you control, Force drain +1 here (+2 if a Gaderffii Stick present).
DarkSideText: If you control, Force drain +1 here (+2 if a Gaderffii Stick present).
Information: Expanding on the already-sprawling planet of Tatooine, Tusken Canyon helps a Sealed Deck game in a number of ways, as well as opening up interesting options in standard Swiss play.\par \par First, in Sealed Deck, the Gaderffii Stick is now a card to be reckoned with, giving a drain of three at a site. It also expands on the capabilities of Tusken Raiders in Sealed Deck.\par \par In a non-Sealed Deck game, this site provides an additional Force drain location, while not giving your opponent too much Force. Combined with a Trooper strategy, Tusken Raiders can be fearsome, giving an immense amount of power in 4 characters. Add in a few Gaderffii Sticks to increase this site's Force drain and make this group even deadlier.
IsPulled: A Sith's Plans (V)\par Baktoid Armor Workshop (V)\par General Nevar (V)\par Voyeur (V)
Combo: Tatooine: Tusken Canyon + Tusken Raiders + Gaderffii Sticks + Darth Vader + Vader's Lightsaber\par This is a powerful combination. With four Raiders plus Vader, you have 16 power and a destiny draw, as well as a swipe with the Lightsaber. If your opponent threatens to kill Vader or one of the Raiders, simply knock away his weapon as quickly as possible. Add in Snipers to take care of Undercover spies, and you have a fairly stable Force drain.

Lore: Developed by Incom/Subpro. Atmospheric fighter adapted for space travel. AF-4 version refitted with Incom 2a fission engines and two Taim & Bak KX5 laser cannons.
Gametext: Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1. Power and maneuver +2 at non-unique cloud sectors. May be carried aboard starships like a vehicle.
Information: The much-anticipated predecessor of Incom's X-wing is finally here. In your sealed deck tournament, you'll find the Z-95 is immune to Tallon Rolls (that interrupt cannot target an independent starship). It has no hyperdrive, but it can be carried on a Corellian Corvette like a vehicle. After the sealed deck event, you'll want lots of these babies in your cloud decks. At non-unique cloud sectors, they hold their own against the Obsidian TIEs from Cloud City.
IsPulled: All Wings Report In\par Local Defense
Combo: Z-95 + Corellian Corvette\par Carry a starfighter on a Light Side capital ship.\par ------\par Z-95 + Out of Nowhere\par Maneuver of 4 is all that is needed.
